results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Psychology Live”.
This program looks at theories of cognitive development over time from the theories of Jean Piaget to those of Jerome Bruner and assesses their contribution to both past and present research into cognitive development and to educational practices. Although tailored to year 12 and tertiary Psychology students, the program’s information is of general interest and contains several practical exercises, real life demonstrations and self-tests. The presenters support the “ecological approach” of cognitive psychology, which values the research done in situations of everyday life, not just in laboratories. This program focuses on introducing the theories of Jean Piaget, his notion of schema, assimilation, accommodation, and equilibration as well as his theory of the stages in cognitive development. His methodology is then explored in detail along with a discussion of recent research findings which disagree with his. Jerome Bruner’s theory and modes of representing the world is then introduced, compared with Piaget’s theories, particulary in relation to the role of language in cognitive development, and included in a discussion of the future of the study of cognitive development in relation to recent research in metacognition and the theory of the mind. Study notes included.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on maturational and environmental factors; and the cognitive learning or cognitive behavioural approach subscribed to by such developmentalists as Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Suitable for tertiary and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: 2 1/2 to 6 years”.
This episode explores two major approaches to cognitive development: Piaget’s theory and the examination of the basic cognitive processes involved in problem solving. In understanding how children think, from the concepts of “magical thought” where children implicitly accept that what an adult says will happen, and where the seperation of fact from fantasy is not clear to a child, to the more complex and abstract thought processes used by older children, the development of the child as a confident thinking individual can be traced.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Cognition involves the acquiring and use of knowledge. From birth, infants must learn how to learn and develop their senses, memory and perception. This episode discusses the stages of cognitive development as well as examining the theories of Piaget, the roles of recognition and receptive memory and the effect of stimulation in developing cognitive skills.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.creator_credit: David Stone and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
This program looks at the work of Jean Piaget and his theories of child development. Piaget divided cognitive development into four stages: sensory-motor; concrete-operational; pre-operational and formal operational. Each of these stages is illustrated, using some of the experiments that he devised. The program concludes by discussing the impact of environment on development, a concept which Piaget did not explore.

results.title: Cognition (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard L. Berman, Glen Howard, Bay State Film Productions and Harper & Row
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines developmental changes in perception, memory, evaluation and reasoning. Includes Piaget’s description of the major stages of development and intelligence and discusses the relevance of attention to detail, recognition and recall memory, conservation of mass and number, and reasoning evaluation.

results.title: Cog
results.brief_description: A 2D digitally composited animation, with a distinctive 3D look. The mechanical, metalloid, surreal environment, as well as the characters, were created from real life cut-outs (from photographs) of everyday objects. COG is a parable about the beauty of life being ground down by an industrial society.

results.title: Coerver coaching method. Vol. 3
results.brief_description: Wiel Coerver, renowned Dutch soccer champion teaches a comprehensive range of soccer skills. Volume 3 of this three-part collection includes the following playing techniques: one on two combination, overlapping, crosses and through passes, heading, shooting.
